messages.messageBody:
>

> sure. It's obvious that instead of really reading posts, certain

If you think that you'd be a target by posting information about gentle
discipline, then *you* haven't been really reading posts.
>
> So instead, I've created a folder entitled "Gentle Discipline" and

> Please feel free to post your own there as well.

Thanks. I'll have a look.
Tia

"They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety
deserve neither liberty nor safety." Ben Franklin
leschke@...

messages.subject: Re: For Oom
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Kelly! You know, I d really love to, but I d be just another target I m sure. It s obvious that instead of really reading posts, certain people here are
messages.messageBody:
Hi Kelly!

You know, I'd really love to, but I'd be just another target I'm
sure. It's obvious that instead of really reading posts, certain
people here are intent on finding fault. It's a no-win situation.

So instead, I've created a folder entitled "Gentle Discipline" and
have added a few things for you all to read at your leisure. I'd love
for you all to join me in adding to this if you'd like. I'll also
include a few of my own ideas about guiding children non-violently.
Please feel free to post your own there as well.

Peace to all,

Jeva

> pinklantern@e... writes:
> > There are easier more positive ways to work with your child
instead
> > of using physical force that would be much better for both you
and
> > your child. I'm certainly open to helping if I can.
>
> Jeva,
>
> I'm sure there are MANY lurkers here to would love some ideas on
peaceful
> parenting. Why not share your ideas with the list?
>
> ~Kelly
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] For Oom
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/21/2003 5:16:05 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Jeva, I m sure there are MANY lurkers here to would love some ideas on peaceful parenting.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/21/2003 5:16:05 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
pinklantern@... writes:
> There are easier more positive ways to work with your child instead
> of using physical force that would be much better for both you and
> your child. I'm certainly open to helping if I can.

Jeva,

I'm sure there are MANY lurkers here to would love some ideas on peaceful
parenting. Why not share your ideas with the list?

~Kelly
